intro: Mouroucoa capitata, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branching. Mouroucoa capitata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
